workshop.exceptions

Class UuidAuthenticationException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • workshop.exceptions.WorkshopException
            • workshop.exceptions.UuidAuthenticationException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class UuidAuthenticationException
extends WorkshopException
    To be thrown in the UsersDetailsService.authenticateNewUserByUuid(UsernamePasswordUuidAuthenticationToken) and bubbled up by LoginAuthenticationFilter.doFilter(ServletRequest, ServletResponse, FilterChain) to inform that the given UUID doesn't math the new User who is trying to login and confirm the registration for the first time with it.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Uuid validUuid
      If the found Uuid is valid (not outdated etc) we have to inform the ExternalLoginController.getLoginRegistrationConfirmation(String, Model, Locale, RedirectAttributes, Authentication) that User just has entered wrong credentials and has to try the first time login again to be confirmed and activated.
